summary: A subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein, commanding its executors to appear in court and produce flight records for Epstein's private airplanes from 1990 to 2005 for the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased defendant, owner of private airplanes
persons.context: The subpoena is directed to his estate, demanding flight records from his private airplanes between 1990 and 2005 for use in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.role: Executor of the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as an executor of Epstein's estate to whom the subpoena is addressed, required to ensure the estate complies with the court order.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.role: Executor of the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as an executor of Epstein's estate to whom the subpoena is addressed, required to ensure the estate complies with the court order.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena is issued in relation to her criminal case (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell), with the requested flight records intended as evidence.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signed and issued the subpoena on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office, demanding the estate's compliance.

connections.description: Indyke is an executor of Epstein's estate, responsible for managing its affairs posthumously.
Kahn is an executor of Epstein's estate, responsible for managing its affairs posthumously.
The subpoena seeks Epstein's flight records as evidence in Maxwell's criminal case, indicating their alleged association in criminal activities.

events.title: Scheduled court appearance for Epstein estate
events.description: The executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate are commanded to appear in court to testify and produce flight records for Epstein's private airplanes from 1990 to 2005.

events.title: Issuance of subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a subpoena to the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein demanding flight records.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 318, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York, Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office subpoenaed Jeffrey Epstein's estate for flight records of his private airplanes from 1990 to 2005, including flight logs and manifests.
The subpoena was issued in connection with the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The estate's executors, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, were ordered to appear in court on November 29, 2021, to testify and produce the records.
Failure to comply would constitute contempt of court, subjecting the estate to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
The document indicates ongoing investigative efforts by prosecutors to gather evidence related to Epstein and Maxwell's activities, specifically focusing on air travel.
